notes.text:
Logging Subsystem 5.4.5 - Red Hat OpenShift

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Logging Subsystem 5.4.5 - Red Hat OpenShift

Security Fix(es):

* golang: net/http: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header (CVE-2022-1705)

* golang: compress/gzip: stack exhaustion in Reader.Read (CVE-2022-30631)

* golang: net/http/httputil: NewSingleHostReverseProxy - omit X-Forwarded-For not working (CVE-2022-32148)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. The HTTP/1 client accepted invalid Transfer-Encoding headers indicating "chunked" encoding. This issue could allow request smuggling, but only if combined with an intermediate server that also improperly accepts the header as invalid.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.10 see the following documentation, which will be updated shortly, for detailed release notes:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.10/logging/cluster-logging-release-notes.html

For Red Hat OpenShift Logging 5.4, see the following instructions to apply this update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.10/logging/cluster-logging-upgrading.html

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http: improper sanitization of Transfer-Encoding header

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. Calling the Reader, Read method on an archive that contains a large number of concatenated 0-length compressed files can cause a panic issue due to stack exhaustion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: compress/gzip: stack exhaustion in Reader.Read
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.10 see the following documentation, which will be updated shortly, for detailed release notes:

For Red Hat OpenShift Logging 5.4, see the following instructions to apply this update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.10/logging/cluster-logging-upgrading.html

vulnerabilities.title: golang: compress/gzip: stack exhaustion in Reader.Read

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A flaw was found in net/http/httputil golang package. When httputil.ReverseProxy.ServeHTTP is called with a Request.Header map containing a nil value for the X-Forwarded-For header, ReverseProxy could set the client IP incorrectly. This issue may affect confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http/httputil: NewSingleHostReverseProxy - omit X-Forwarded-For not working
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
